In diesel

Macro diesel::impl_query_id

source Â· [−]
macro_rules! impl_query_id {
    ($name: ident) => { ... };
    ($name: ident<$($ty_param: ident),+>) => { ... };
    (noop: $name: ident) => { ... };
    (noop: $name: ident<$($ty_param: ident),+>) => { ... };
}
ðŸ‘Ž Deprecated since 1.1.0:

Use #[derive(QueryId)] instead

Expand description

Provides a standard implementation of QueryId. Apps should not need to concern themselves with this macro.

This macro should be called with the name of your type, along with all of itâ€™s type parameters. If the SQL generated by your type not uniquely identifiable by the type itself, you should put noop: in front.

For example, given the type And<Left, Right>, invoking impl_query_id!(And<Left, Right>) will generate:

â“˜
impl<Left, Right> QueryId for And<Left, Right>
where
    Left: QueryId,
    Right: QueryId,
{
    type QueryId = And<Left::QueryId, Right::QueryId>;

    const HAS_STATIC_QUERY_ID: bool = Left::HAS_STATIC_QUERY_ID && Right::HAS_STATIC_QUERY_ID;
}

Invoking impl_query_id!(noop: And<Left, Right>) will generate:

â“˜
impl<Left, Right> QueryId for And<Left, Right> {
    type QueryId = ();

    const HAS_STATIC_QUERY_ID: bool = false;
}
